pull.title: Fix input size assertion in wallet_bumpfee.py
pull.body:
I was investigating a curious error for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17290 and realized that this check should have caught that error earlier in the test.

The loop is intended to ensure that only a single input exists the entire time until the change output disappears, a single additional bump occurs, then it leaves the loop.

events.body: What about renaming both to the same name? e.g. `input_list`, since it always refers to the input list, regardless of what iteration we are on.

> What about renaming both to the same name?

IIRC it made it easier for me to think about the test as I wrote it, but if others find that clearer I can do that too

events.message: Fix input size assertion in wallet_bumpfee.py

events.body: In the interest of a quicker merge of this clear test bug, took Marco's suggestion
Sorry, I think the previous solution was also fine. Just forgot about this.

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.
